page.title: 01My Day Begins-Francis.Age 11
page.content: My bodily clock rattles in my head dead on time. 7.15 am. As usual, Dad stomps into the room, the half asleep hippo of the awakening horizon. He always asks me what I want for breakfast. I say cereal and find out he's already got something cooking for me. I never eat it. I'm too tired. But it doesn't go to waste. He eats it when he comes home from work. I get up rather reluctantly at 7.45 am. And that's not through my own conscience either; it's my sister. She's always harassing me in the mornings. I get up and wait for her to disappear. She's five years older than me. I can't wait for her to move out. No more blaring stereo. No more sickly hair spray. Total peace. In strolls Mum. Thus ends my 30 seconds of tranquility.
